simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command performs no other function than to increment the command execution counter. The command may be used to verify general aliveness of the Event Services task.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The CFE_EVS_NOOP_EID informational event message will be generated

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para: There are no error conditions for this command. If the Event Services receives the command, the event is sent (although it may be filtered by EVS itself) and the counter is incremented unconditionally.

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
This command resets the following counters within the Event Services housekeeping telemetry:
Command Execution Counter ($sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC)
Command Error Counter ($sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC)

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The CFE_EVS_RSTCNT_EID debug event message will be generated

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para: There are no error conditions for this command. If the Event Services receives the command, the event is sent (although it may be filtered by EVS) and the counter is incremented unconditionally.

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: This command is not inherently dangerous. However, it is possible for ground systems and on-board safing procedures to be designed such that they react to changes in the counter values that are reset by this command.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command enables the command specified Event Type allowing event messages of this type to be sent through Event Service. An Event Type is defined to be a classification of an Event Message such as debug, informational, error and critical. This command is a global enable of a particular event type, it applies to all applications.

simplesect.title: Command Structure
simplesect.para: CFE_EVS_BitMaskCmd_t The following bit positions apply to structure member named 'BitMask'. Bit 0 - Debug Bit 1 - Informational Bit 2 - Error Bit 3 - Critical A one in a bit position means the event type will be enabled (or unfiltered). A zero in a bit position means the filtering state is unchanged.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para: Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:

listitem.para: The generation of CFE_EVS_ENAEVTTYPE_EID debug message

detaileddescription.para:
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s): Invalid Event Type selection

Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Enabling an event type is not particularly hazardous, as the result may be turning on necessary event messages and communication to the ground system. However, inappropriately enabling an event type could result in flooding of the system.
CFE_EVS_DISABLE_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_ENABLE_APP_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_APP_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_ENABLE_APP_EVENTS_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_APP_EVENTS_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command disables the command specified Event Type preventing event messages of this type to be sent through Event Service. An Event Type is defined to be a classification of an Event Message such as debug, informational, error and critical. This command is a global disable of a particular event type, it applies to all applications.

simplesect.title: Command Structure
simplesect.para: CFE_EVS_BitMaskCmd_t The following bit positions apply to structure member named 'BitMask'. Bit 0 - Debug Bit 1 - Informational Bit 2 - Error Bit 3 - Critical A one in a bit position means the event type will be disabled (or filtered). A zero in a bit position means the filtering state is unchanged.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para: Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:

listitem.para: The generation of CFE_EVS_DISEVTTYPE_EID debug message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para: This command may fail for the following reason(s):

detaileddescription.para:
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Disabling an event type is not particularly hazardous, as the result may be shutting off unnecessary event messages and possible event flooding of the system. However, inappropriately disabling an event type could result in a loss of critical information and missed behavior for the ground system.
CFE_EVS_ENABLE_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_ENABLE_APP_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_APP_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_ENABLE_APP_EVENTS_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_APP_EVENTS_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command sets the event format mode to the command specified value. The event format mode may be either short or long. A short event format detaches the Event Data from the event message and only includes the following information in the event packet: Processor ID, Application ID, Event ID, and Event Type. Refer to section 5.3.3.4 for a description of the Event Service event packet contents. Event Data is defined to be data describing an Event that is supplied to the cFE Event Service. ASCII text strings are used as the primary format for Event Data because heritage ground systems use string compares as the basis for their automated alert systems. Two systems, ANSR and SERS were looked at for interface definitions. The short event format is used to accommodate experiences with limited telemetry bandwidth. The long event format includes all event information included within the short format along with the Event Data.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para: Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:

listitem.para: The generation of CFE_EVS_SETEVTFMTMOD_EID debug message

detaileddescription.para:
Error Conditions
This command may fail for the following reason(s): Invalid SB message (command) length Invalid MODE selection Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Setting the event format mode is not particularly hazardous, as the result may be saving necessary bandwidth. However, inappropriately setting the event format mode could result in a loss of information and missed behavior for the ground system

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command enables the command specified event type for the command specified application, allowing the application to send event messages of the command specified event type through Event Service. An Event Type is defined to be a classification of an Event Message such as debug, informational, critical, and error. Note: In order for this command to take effect, applications must be registered for Event Service.

simplesect.title: Command Structure
simplesect.para: CFE_EVS_AppNameBitMaskCmd_t The following bit positions apply to structure member named 'BitMask'. Bit 0 - Debug Bit 1 - Informational Bit 2 - Error Bit 3 - Critical A one in a bit position means the event type will be enabled (or unfiltered) for the specified application. A zero in a bit position means the filtering state is unchanged for the specified application.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_ENAAPPEVTTYPE_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid Event Type Selection
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Enabling an application¿s event type is not particularly hazardous, as the result may be turning on necessary event messages and communication to the ground system. However, inappropriately enabling an application's event type could result in flooding of the ground system.
CFE_EVS_ENABLE_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_APP_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_ENABLE_APP_EVENTS_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_APP_EVENTS_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command disables the command specified event type for the command specified application, preventing the application from sending event messages of the command specified event type through Event Service. An Event Type is defined to be a classification of an Event Message such as debug, informational, critical, and error. Note: In order for this command to take effect, applications must be registered for Event Service.

simplesect.title: Command Structure
simplesect.para: CFE_EVS_AppNameBitMaskCmd_t The following bit positions apply to structure member named 'BitMask'. Bit 0 - Debug Bit 1 - Informational Bit 2 - Error Bit 3 - Critical A one in a bit position means the event type will be disabled (or filtered) for the specified application. A zero in a bit position means the filtering state is unchanged for the specified application.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_DISAPPENTTYPE_EID debug event message
The clearing of the Active Flag in The Active Flag in EVS App Data File

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid Event Type Selection
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Disabling an application's event type is not particularly hazardous, as the result may be shutting off unnecessary event messages and possible event flooding of the system. However, inappropriately disabling an application's event type could result in a loss of critical information and missed behavior for the ground system.
CFE_EVS_ENABLE_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_ENABLE_APP_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_ENABLE_APP_EVENTS_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_APP_EVENTS_CC

xrefdescription.para: Enable Event Services for an Application

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command enables the command specified application to send events through the Event Service. Note: In order for this command to take effect, applications must be registered for Event Service.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_ENAAPPEVT_EID debug event message
The setting of the Active Flag in The Active Flag in EVS App Data File

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Application selected is not registered to receive Event Service
Application ID is out of range
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Enabling an application¿s events is not particularly hazardous, as the result may be turning on necessary event messages and communication to the ground system. However, inappropriately enabling an application's events could result in flooding of the ground system.
CFE_EVS_ENABLE_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_ENABLE_APP_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_APP_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_APP_EVENTS_CC

xrefdescription.para: Disable Event Services for an Application

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command disables the command specified application from sending events through Event Service. Note: In order for this command to take effect, applications must be registered for Event Service.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_DISAPPEVT_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Application selected is not registered to receive Event Service
Application ID is out of range
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Disabling an application's events is not particularly hazardous, as the result may be shutting off unnecessary event messages and possible event flooding of the system. However, inappropriately disabling an application's events could result in a loss of critical information and missed behavior for the ground system.
CFE_EVS_ENABLE_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_ENABLE_APP_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_DISABLE_APP_EVENT_TYPE_CC, CFE_EVS_ENABLE_APP_EVENTS_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command sets the command specified application's event counter to zero. Note: In order for this command to take effect, applications must be registered for Event Service.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_RSTEVTCNT_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Application selected is not registered to receive Event Service
Application ID is out of range
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: This command is not inherently dangerous. However, it is possible for ground systems and on-board safing procedures to be designed such that they react to changes in the counter value that is reset by this command.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command sets the command specified application's event filter mask to the command specified value for the command specified event. Note: In order for this command to take effect, applications must be registered for Event Service.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_SETFILTERMSK_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Application selected is not registered to receive Event Service
Application ID is out of range
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Setting an application¿s event filter mask is not particularly hazardous, as the result may be shutting off unnecessary event messages and possible event flooding of the system. However, inappropriately setting an application's event filter mask could result in a loss of critical information and missed behavior for the ground system or flooding of the ground system.
CFE_EVS_RESET_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_RESET_ALL_FILTERS_CC, CFE_EVS_ADD_EVENT_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_DELETE_EVENT_FILTER_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command enables the command specified port to output event messages

simplesect.title: Command Structure
simplesect.para: CFE_EVS_BitMaskCmd_t The following bit positions apply to structure member named 'BitMask'. Bit 0 - Port 1 Bit 1 - Port 2 Bit 2 - Port 3 Bit 3 - Port 4 A one in a bit position means the port will be enabled. A zero in a bit position means the port state is unchanged.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_ENAPORT_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Invalid PORT selection
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: None.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command disables the specified port from outputting event messages.

simplesect.title: Command Structure
simplesect.para: CFE_EVS_BitMaskCmd_t The following bit positions apply to structure member named 'BitMask'. Bit 0 - Port 1 Bit 1 - Port 2 Bit 2 - Port 3 Bit 3 - Port 4 A one in a bit position means the port will be disabled. A zero in a bit position means the port state is unchanged.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_DISPORT_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Invalid PORT selection
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: None.

xrefdescription.para: Reset an Event Filter for an Application

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command resets the command specified application's event filter for the command specified event ID. Note: In order for this command to take effect, applications must be registered for Event Service.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_RSTFILTER_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Application selected is not registered to receive Event Service
Application ID is out of range
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: None.
CFE_EVS_SET_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_RESET_ALL_FILTERS_CC, CFE_EVS_ADD_EVENT_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_DELETE_EVENT_FILTER_CC

xrefdescription.para: Reset All Event Filters for an Application

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command resets all of the command specified applications event filters. Note: In order for this command to take effect, applications must be registered for Event Service.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_RSTALLFILTER_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Application selected is not registered to receive Event Service
Application ID is out of range
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: None.
CFE_EVS_SET_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_RESET_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_ADD_EVENT_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_DELETE_EVENT_FILTER_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command adds the given filter for the given application identifier and event identifier. Note: In order for this command to take effect, applications must be registered for Event Service.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_ADDFILTER_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Application selected is not registered to receive Event Service
Application ID is out of range
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: None.
CFE_EVS_SET_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_RESET_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_RESET_ALL_FILTERS_CC, CFE_EVS_DELETE_EVENT_FILTER_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command removes the given filter for the given application identifier and event identifier. Note: In order for this command to take effect, applications must be registered for Event Service.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_DELFILTER_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Application selected is not registered to receive Event Service
Application ID is out of range
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: None.
CFE_EVS_SET_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_RESET_FILTER_CC, CFE_EVS_RESET_ALL_FILTERS_CC, CFE_EVS_ADD_EVENT_FILTER_CC

xrefdescription.para: Write Event Services Application Information to File

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command writes all application data to a file for all applications that have registered with the EVS. The application data includes the Application ID, Active Flag, Event Count, Event Types Active Flag, and Filter Data.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_WRDAT_EID debug event message
The generation of the file written to

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Writing a file is not particularly hazardous, but if proper file management is not taken, then the file system can fill up if this command is used repeatedly.
CFE_EVS_FILE_WRITE_LOG_DATA_CC, CFE_EVS_SET_LOG_MODE_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command requests the Event Service to generate a file containing the contents of the local event log.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_WRLOG_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Writing a file is not particularly hazardous, but if proper file management is not taken, then the file system can fill up if this command is used repeatedly.
CFE_EVS_FILE_WRITE_APP_DATA_CC, CFE_EVS_SET_LOG_MODE_CC, CFE_EVS_CLEAR_LOG_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command sets the logging mode to the command specified value.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment
The generation of CFE_EVS_LOGMODE_EID debug event message

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Invalid MODE selected
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Setting the event logging mode is not particularly hazardous, as the result may be saving valuable event data. However, inappropriately setting the log mode could result in a loss of critical information. Note: the event log is a back-up log to the on-board recorder.
CFE_EVS_FILE_WRITE_LOG_DATA_CC, CFE_EVS_CLEAR_LOG_CC

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This command clears the contents of the local event log.

simplesect.title: Command Verification
simplesect.para:
Successful execution of this command may be verified with the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDPC - command execution counter will increment

simplesect.title: Error Conditions
simplesect.para:
This command may fail for the following reason(s):
Invalid SB message (command) length
Evidence of failure may be found in the following telemetry:
$sc_$cpu_EVS_CMDEC - command error counter will increment
An Error specific event message

simplesect.title: Criticality
simplesect.para: Clearing the local event log is not particularly hazardous, as the result may be making available space to record valuable event data. However, inappropriately clearing the local event log could result in a loss of critical information. Note: the event log is a back-up log to the on-board recorder.
CFE_EVS_FILE_WRITE_LOG_DATA_CC, CFE_EVS_SET_LOG_MODE_CC
